intro: Coccoloba rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf cedar or simply cedar, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically growing in coastal areas and disturbed soils. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves that are round or heart-shaped, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers. It is often used in landscaping due to its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. The plant also has historical uses in traditional medicine.
